clinical_study.brief_title: Acceptability, Representations and Experiences of the COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Acceptability, Representations and Experiences of the COVID-19 Pandemic : the ARECOVID Project

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

collaborator.agency: Université Jean Monnet - Chaire Santé des Ainés

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock: The "ARECOVID" project is a comprehensive sociological study of what is being played out in organizational terms in the face of the COVID-19 pandemic. Through quantitative methods (questionnaires) and qualitative methods (semi-directive interviews), we would understand the essential views of the populations concerned by COVID-19, but also that of actors taking care of vulnerable elderly non-COVID. Special attention will be paid to the care pathway of elderly people with and without the virus, in a health system in full reorganization. We will try to understand the needs and experiences of all health actors (hospital/city) involved in COVID-19 and the experience of confinement and the Covid-19 of the elderly living at home, in order to reflect on a possible improvement in the health response of elderly people in the event of an epidemic health crisis.

detailed_description.textblock: understand the needs and experiences of all health actors (hospital/city) involved in COVID-19 and the experience of confinement and the Covid-19 of the elderly living at home

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis representations of COVID-19 and confinement of older people

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis impacts of COVID-19 in works of caregivers

arm_group.description: Caregivers who work with older patients will be included. They will have a questionnaire
Older 65 people who live alone in their house will be included. They will have Individual interviews.

intervention.description: Questions about the impact of COVID-19 in their works
Discussion between the searcher and the participant about representations of COVID-19 and experiences about confinement.

study_pop.textblock: Older 65 people Caregivers who works in gerontology

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- For older people : minimum age : 65 years
- For caregivers : works in gerontology
Exclusion Criteria:
- Person with a neurological disease
- Person under guardianship or curatorship
